results.title: Exploring the human nervous system
results.brief_description: The advances being made in research into the workings of the human nervous system. The nervous system itself is described by means of animated drawings. Also indicates what is being done to understand memory and learning. Compares the nervous systems of the hydra and the earth worm with the complex human nervous system.

results.title: Exploring the atomic nucleus
results.brief_description: Protons and neutrons are now known to be composed of dozens of other particles whose interactions have yet to be accurately described. Physicists are detecting and analysing particle interactions with the aid of particle accelerators, bubble chambers and other sophisticated devices of high energy physics, thus arriving at a fuller understanding of the atomic nucleus.

results.title: Hi daddy (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Follows the family of a four-year-old girl through one afternoon showing her mother, father, and her five-year-old brother.

results.title: The Explorer
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: Albert Tucker (1914-) is an intellectual artist with great independence of mind and mental courage. He has succeeded in fashioning a distinctive style and is now one of the leading artists in Australia. This film is based on a series of paintings by Tucker which deals with an unnamed explorer who perished in the outback desert. Imaginative paintings in an imaginative film.

results.title: Explorations (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: George Brandt and University of Bristol. Dept. of Drama
results.brief_description: Portrays a drama class taught by Veronica Sherborne which explores ways of using movement as an approach to dramatic expression. Illustrates basic movement experiences that can give people a sense of confidence in their body mastery and creativity. Three themes are developed: a relation to and awareness of others; an awareness of the ground; and an awareness of one’s own body.

results.title: Exploration 1770, reviewed 1970
results.creator_credit: Stanley Dalby, Tim Reid, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Contrasts Captain Cook’s observations on his voyage along the eastern coast of Australia in 1770 with scenes of the Royal Visit in 1970 and bicentenary celebrations including re-enactments of his landings. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Exploding cities
results.creator_credit: Tina Viljoen, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: At the beginning of this century earth was still a rural planet. By the year 2000, two out of three of us will be living in cities. This film examines the causes of this massive migration, the terrible poverty that ensues, and what steps are being taken in some cities in the developing world to cope with the great influx of people. It also notes attempts made by some countries to deal with the problem, e.g. sites and services programs in Senegal and Pakistan, self-help construction projects in Colombia, and house upgrading schemes in Zambia. Voice and narration by Bronwyn Drainie.

results.title: Experiment in teaching
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Crabb, James Carr, Department of Education and Science (UK) and World Wide
results.brief_description: A description of new methods of teaching applied science in schools, with particular reference to engineering and technology. The film visits a number of schools including the Technical Activities Centre at Sevenoaks School and Cray Valley Technical High School where practical interest in such projects as making a steam engine, and a go-kart, encourage theoretical study. The common objective of these courses is to develop the pupils’ creative qualities of imaginative thought.

results.title: Experience of cubism
results.brief_description: An attempt to interpret the underlying principles and methods of cubism. The film compares examples of experimental art with objects as we actually see them and shows how the artist continues to draw on nature for the source of their material, but recomposes it for their own specific ends.

results.title: Expedition to Franklin Island
results.brief_description: Describes an expedition organized by Marineland of South Australia to Franklin Island in 1974. The party, which included experienced field naturalists, divers and photographers, observed and recorded the behaviour of aquatic and land animals. Credits include: script and edited by Douglas Steen; photographed by Peter George, Peter Caprioli, Igo Oak, Doug Seaton; sound by Ray Swaby, Norman Robinson; commentary by Roger Caldwell.
